com.rohanclan.cfml.editors
Class ICFDocument

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.jface.text.AbstractDocument
      org.eclipse.jface.text.Document
          com.rohanclan.cfml.editors.ICFDocument
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICFEFileDocument, org.eclipse.jface.text.IDocument, org.eclipse.jface.text.IDocumentExtension, org.eclipse.jface.text.IDocumentExtension2, org.eclipse.jface.text.IDocumentExtension3, org.eclipse.jface.text.IRepairableDocument
public class ICFDocument
extends org.eclipse.jface.text.Document
implements ICFEFileDocument

This is mostly just a wrapper document that holds the parser and is attached to a Document. So if you can get access to a document you can get to this and get the parser.

If you have an IDocument you can perform the following to get an ICFDocument: 

 \/\/
 if(doc instanceof ICFDocument)
 { 
   ICFDocument cfDoc = (ICFDocument)doc;
   ... perform operations ...

With an ICFDocument class you are able to access the parse result.

Author:
Rob

clearAllMarkers

getCFDocument

public CFDocument getCFDocument()
Gets the parse result of this document.

Returns:
If not null, the parse result, if null there was a parse error.

getContentAssistManager

public CFEContentAssistManager getContentAssistManager()
Retrieves the Content Assist Manager (CAM) for this document. This is the manager for the CACors that are associated with this document. The current implementation of this simply retrieves the CFE-global CAM as project natures are not yet implemented. Once implemented this will work in the default manner.

Specified by:
getContentAssistManager in interface ICFEFileDocument
Returns:
The CAM that will provide CACors for this document.
